info.description: Capital flows are the cash and asset subscriptions coming into a fund and the cash and asset redemptions going out of a fund (e.g., client contributions, withdrawals, and initial funding for a portfolio). This API permits users to validate, create, update, and receive capital flows transactions and their details. User needs standard API permissison ALADDIN_API_USER to use the Capital Flows API and standard newcash permissions to perform different actions. Please refer to the Capital Flows User Guide on the client landing page for more information on newcash permission structure.
info.title: Capital Flows 1.0.0

post.description:
User would require standard newcash permissions to perform action(s) based on business workflow and user's role (Standard newcash permissions are: VIEW_NEWCASH, CASH_PAY, CASH_MOD, CASH_CONF, ASSET_MOD, ASSET_CONF, CASH_TRANSFER, ASSET_TRANSFER).
(-- api-linter: aladdin::9002::wordslist-custom-method-http=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this method name is more meaningful ... --)
post.summary: Transition capital flows to a given state

post.description:
User would require standard newcash permissions to perform action(s) based on business workflow and user's role (Standard newcash permissions are: VIEW_NEWCASH, CASH_PAY, CASH_MOD, CASH_CONF, ASSET_MOD, ASSET_CONF, CASH_TRANSFER, ASSET_TRANSFER).

Recommendation for usage:

(1) For real-time Capital flows posting, recommendation is to provide 1-50 Capital Flows/request with up to 100 such requests per minute.

(2) For large batch of Capital Flow posting, the recommendation is to provide 1-20 requests per minute with up to 250 Capital flows/request. Subsequent requests should be sent once the response for previous request(s) is received. Also, If a timeout is received, then reduce the number of flows/requests to 200 or less.

(3) Do not update the same Capital Flows across multiple concurrent requests. Prefer to use distinct batches across concurrent Capital Flows requests.

(4) For concurrent requests, it is recommended to provide Capital Flows version in each request.
post.summary: Validate all capital flows in single batch

post.description:
User would require standard newcash permissions to perform action(s) based on business workflow and user's role (Standard newcash permissions are: VIEW_NEWCASH, CASH_PAY, CASH_MOD, CASH_CONF, ASSET_MOD, ASSET_CONF, CASH_TRANSFER, ASSET_TRANSFER).

Recommendation for usage:

(1) For real-time Capital flows posting, recommendation is to provide 1-50 Capital Flows/request with up to 100 such requests per minute.

(2) For large batch of Capital Flow posting, the recommendation is to provide 1-20 requests per minute with up to 250 Capital flows/request. Subsequent requests should be sent once the response for previous request(s) is received. Also, If a timeout is received, then reduce the number of flows/requests to 200 or less.

(3) Do not update the same Capital Flows across multiple concurrent requests. Prefer to use distinct batches across concurrent Capital Flows requests.

(4) For concurrent requests, it is recommended to provide Capital Flows version in each request.

Any.description:
`Any` contains an arbitrary serialized message along with a
URL that describes the type of the serialized message

@type.description: A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized message.

enumsAction.description:
Represents capital flow lifecycle transition actions.

 - ACTION_UNSPECIFIED: Represents unspecified action.
 - ACTION_AUTHORIZE: Represents authorize action.
 - ACTION_CONFIRM: Represents confirm action.
 - ACTION_UNCONFIRM: Represents unconfirm action.
 - ACTION_REQUEST_CANCEL: Represents request cancel action.
 - ACTION_AUTHORIZE_CANCEL: Represents authorize cancel action.
 - ACTION_REJECT_CANCEL: Represents reject cancel action.
 - ACTION_CANCEL: Represents cancel action.
 - ACTION_RESET: Represents reset action.
 - ACTION_FINALISE: Represents finalise action.

enumsCapitalFlowBasis.description:
Describes the basis of capital flow record.

 - CAPITAL_FLOW_BASIS_UNSPECIFIED: Represents unspecified basis.
 - CAPITAL_FLOW_BASIS_UNIT: Represents unit basis.
 - CAPITAL_FLOW_BASIS_CASH: Represents cash basis.
 - CAPITAL_FLOW_BASIS_SELL_ALL: Represents sell all basis.
 - CAPITAL_FLOW_BASIS_TEMPORARY: Represents temporary basis.
 - CAPITAL_FLOW_BASIS_PERCENT: Represents percent basis.

enumsCapitalFlowTransactionType.description:
Describes capital flow transaction type.
(*Required).

 - CAPITAL_FLOW_TRANSACTION_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Represents unspecified transaction type.
 - CAPITAL_FLOW_TRANSACTION_TYPE_CASHIN: Represents CASHIN transaction type.
 - CAPITAL_FLOW_TRANSACTION_TYPE_CASHOUT: Represents CASHOUT transaction type.
 - CAPITAL_FLOW_TRANSACTION_TYPE_ASSETIN: Represents ASSETIN transaction type.
 - CAPITAL_FLOW_TRANSACTION_TYPE_ASSETOUT: Represents ASSETOUT transaction type.
 - CAPITAL_FLOW_TRANSACTION_TYPE_TRANSFERIN: Represents TRANSFERIN transaction type.
 - CAPITAL_FLOW_TRANSACTION_TYPE_TRANSFEROUT: Represents TRANSFEROUT transaction type.
 - CAPITAL_FLOW_TRANSACTION_TYPE_ASSETTRNFRIN: Represents ASSETTRNFRIN transaction type.
 - CAPITAL_FLOW_TRANSACTION_TYPE_ASSETTRNFROUT: Represents ASSETTRNFROUT transaction type.

enumsEstimateState.description:
Describes estimated state of capital flow.
(*Required).

 - ESTIMATE_STATE_UNSPECIFIED: Represents unspecified estimated state.
 - ESTIMATE_STATE_ESTIMATED: Represents estimated state as estimated.
 - ESTIMATE_STATE_FINAL: Represents estimated state as final.

enumsPricingMethodology.description:
Describes the pricing methodology of capital flow record.

 - PRICING_METHODOLOGY_UNSPECIFIED: Represents unspecified pricing methodology
 - PRICING_METHODOLOGY_CANCELLED: Represents cancelled pricing methodology.
 - PRICING_METHODOLOGY_ESTIMATE: Represents estimate pricing methodology.
Estimate pricing methodology is always unpriced.
 - PRICING_METHODOLOGY_UNPRICED: Represents unpriced pricing methodology .
 - PRICING_METHODOLOGY_PRICED: Represents priced pricing methodology.

enumsSeverity.description:
Severity describes whether it is a warning or restriction.

 - SEVERITY_UNSPECIFIED: Default value.
 - SEVERITY_WARNING: Warning.
 - SEVERITY_RESTRICTION: Restriction.

enumsState.description:
Describes the capital flow status.

 - STATE_UNSPECIFIED: Represents unspecified status.
 - STATE_OPEN: Represents open status.
 - STATE_CANCEL: Represents cancel status.
 - STATE_AUTHORIZED: Represents authorized status.
 - STATE_CONFIRMED: Represents confirmed status.
 - STATE_CANCEL_REQUESTED: Represents cancel requested status.

enumsTrueUp.description:
Describes the true-up analysis of capital flow record.

 - TRUE_UP_UNSPECIFIED: Represents unspecified true up.
 - TRUE_UP_NOT_STARTED: Represents not started true up.
 - TRUE_UP_FA_PRICES_APPLIED_DEPENDENCY: Represents fund accountant prices applied - Dependency true up
 - TRUE_UP_FA_PRICES_APPLIED: Represents fund accountant prices applied true up
 - TRUE_UP_DEALING_PRICES_APPLIED_DEPENDENCY: Represents dealing prices applied - Dependency true up
 - TRUE_UP_DEALING_PRICES_APPLIED: Represents dealing prices applied true up.
 - TRUE_UP_PRICED: Represents priced true up.

rpcStatus.description:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for
different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is
used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains
three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details.

You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the
[API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

code.description: The status code, which should be an enum value of [google.rpc.Code][google.rpc.Code].

message.description:
A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any
user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the
[google.rpc.Status.details][google.rpc.Status.details] field, or localized by the client.

details.description:
A list of messages that carry the error details.  There is a common set of
message types for APIs to use.

enrichedCapitalFlows.title:
Array of capital flows transactions.
portfolioId, tradeDate, settlementDate, cashAmount, cashOriginator, capitalFlow transactionType, estimateState, and CurrencyCode are all mandatory fields for a validate request

v1EnrichedCapitalFlow.title:
EnrichedCapitalFlow describes capital flows are the cash and asset subscriptions
coming newly into a fund as well as the cash and asset redemptions going out of a fund 
(e.g. client contributions, withdrawals, and initial funding for a portfolio)

id.title: Unique Id for capital flows transaction record. Numeric value as a string

cashAmount.description:
Cash amount in the specified currency.
Incoming cash is positive, outgoing cash is negative
(*Required).

enrichedCapitalFlowTransactionType.title:
Represents transaction type of capital flow
(*Required)

cashOriginator.title:
The cash originator is non-Aladdin system or third party from which this newcash originated.
At BlackRock and some clients, this is a picklist whose valid values are in the CASH_ORIGINATOR decode.
At other clients, this is a free-form field
(*Required)

currencyCode.title:
The currency's ISO code, e.g., USD, EUR, NOK, SGD, etc.
This is widely available publicly. For a full list in Aladdin, see the B_CURRENCY decode
(*Required)

createTime.title: Timestamp when this record was created

modifier.title: Aladdin user Id that last modified this record

modifyTime.title: Timestamp when this record was modified

state.title:
Describes the capital flow status
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: this Represents capital flow state. --)

authorizeTime.title: Datetime when this record was authorized

creator.title: Aladdin user Id that created this record

confirmTime.title: Timestamp when this record was confirmed

fxRate.title: Exchange rate to base currency for this capital flow transaction

externalEnrichedCapitalFlowIds.title: List of external capital flows transaction Ids

enrichedCapitalFlowComment.title: General comment on capital flows transaction record

orderId.title:
Unique Aladdin Id for the order related transaction (e.g., placement, trade, capital flow).
This is the Aladdin order number which is related to capital flow transaction
(aip.dev/beta-blocker: This should reference
a trading order resource once it is created.)

orderType.title:
Order type
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this ia more meaningful type name... --)

reason.title:
Reason for cash movement.
Valid values include INITFUND (Initial Funding), CLIENT (client contribution), SUBS (Subscriptions), REDS (Redemptions), OTHER (Other), etc.
Full list of values stored in NEWCASH_REASON decode

systemOwner.title:
The source that currently owns this record.
This value is used to maintain exclusive update rights to the record
to one particular source so that other sources cannot update this record

touchCount.title: The number of times this record has been touched/modified

trueUp.description: Describes the true-up analysis of capital flows transaction.

unitOwnerId.title: Portfolio code that is subscribing to this fund with these units

unitPrice.title: The price paid or received for each unit issued

unitsIssue.title: The units of a pooled fund issued related to this capital flows transaction

enrichedCapitalFlowBasis.title: Represents basis on which the capital flow is denominated

assetId.title: Aladdin asset Id. May represent a portfolio or an index

pricedEntity.title: The entity that priced the order

enrichedCapitalFlowSource.title: source of the capital flows transaction

clientPaymentReference.title: Free form text field for payment ref field on swift

cancelRequestor.title:
Person that requested cancellation.
When populated by Aladdin, this will be an Aladdin user Id

cancelApprover.title:
Aladdin user Id that approved cancellation.
When populated by internal systems, this will be a system Id

enrichedCapitalFlowTransferDetail.title: Represents enriched capital flow transfer detail

v1EnrichedCapitalFlowQuery.title:
Describes capital flow search query. organizationId, tradeDate, portfolioId.
must not be provided as individual criteria

primaryExternalIds.title: Capital flows transactions primary external Ids

organizationId.title:
External organization Id.
This must be provided with at least one of the following fields (ids, primaryExternalIds, portfolioIds and tradeDate, orderIds)
(-- api-linter: core::0124::valid-reference=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is a valid resource... --)

orderIds.title: Aladdin Order Ids This should reference a trading order resource once it is created. --)

portfolioTickers.title:
Aladdin portfolio tickers.
This array must be provided with at least one of the following fields (ids, primaryExternalIds, tradeDate, orderIds)

tradeDate.title:
Capital flows transaction trade date.
This must be provided with at least one of the following fields (ids, primaryExternalIds, portfolioIds, orderIds)

portfolioGroupTickers.title:
Aladdin portfolio group tickers.
This array must be provided with at least one of the following fields (ids, primaryExternalIds, tradeDate, orderIds)

modifyDate.title:
Capital flows transaction modify date.
This must be provided with at least one of the following fields (ids, primaryExternalIds, portfolioIds, orderIds)

v1EnrichedCapitalFlowTransferDetail.title: Describes enriched capital flow transfer details

transferId.title:
This field contains the unique Id of the reciprocal transfer, where a subscription into one fund is a redemption from another fund.
This can also represent an interfund transfer, where a trade out of one fund is a trade into another fund.
If a redemption from fund A has unique Id 123 and transfer Id 456, then the reciprocal subscription into fund B will have unique Id 456 and transfer Id 123

transferBrokerCode.description: Counterparty code for transfer counterparty ticker.

enrichedCapitalFlowId.description:
Capital flows transaction newcash Id
For state transition of existing newcash, request should provide either EnrichedCapitalFlowId or primaryExternalId.
Provided key value will be used to identify unique newcash record for state transition.

version.title:
Capital flows transaction record version. The value provided here should increment the current version/touchCount by one.
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because it refers to version of capital flow record... --)

action.title:
Capital flows transaction state transition details

Capital flows transaction updated External Identifier for newcash record

v1FilterEnrichedCapitalFlowsByHistorical.title:
The request message for EnrichedCapitalFlowAPI.FilterEnrichedCapitalFlowsByHistoricalTransactionsRequest.
Presently pagination is not supported

pageSize.description:
The maximum number of capital flows transaction records to return.
The service may return fewer than this value.

pageToken.description:
When paginating, all other parameters provided to
'FilterEnrichedCapitalFlowsByHistoricalTransactions' must match the call that provided the page
token.
This field is not being used presently
pageToken.title:
A page token, received from a previous 'FilterEnrichedCapitalFlowsByHistoricalTransactions' call.
Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page

query.title: Represents capital flow revisions search query

enrichedCapitalFlows.title: The entities that match the specified FilterEnrichedCapitalFlowsByHistoricalTransactionsRequest

nextPageToken.title:
A token, which can be sent as 'page_token' to retrieve the next page.
If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages

Describes enriched capital flow search query.
organizationId, tradeDate, and portfolioId cannot be provided as individual criteria - they must accompany the fields specified in the field descriptions

enrichedCapitalFlows.title: enriched capital flows to be returned

nextPageToken.title:
A token, which can be sent as 'page_token' to retrieve the next page.
If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages.
This field is not being used presently

enrichedCapitalFlows.description:
Id and primaryExternalId are not mandatory fields when creating new capital flows transactions. If neither field is included in the request, Aladdin will create a new capital flows transaction and generate and return an Id in the response. Here are a few example scenarios:

(1) If the Id field is present in the request and the value matches an existing Id, then the existing capital flows transaction is updated. If the Id value does not match an existing record in the database, then a restriction is returned in the response

(2) If the Id field is not present in the request, then a new capital flow is created and its Id is auto-generated and returned in the response

(3) If the primaryExternalId field is present in the request and the value matches an existing primaryExternalId, then the existing capital flows transaction record is updated. If the primaryExternalId value does not match an existing record in the database, then a new capital flow will be created with the given primaryExternalId value and a new Id is auto-generated and returned in the response
enrichedCapitalFlows.title: Array of capital flows transactions. portfolioId, tradeDate, settlementDate, cashAmount, cashOriginator, capitalFlow transactionType, estimateState, and currencyCode are mandatory fields to create new capital flows transactions

manualStateCycle.description:
Represents manual state cycle.
This enables the API to respect the capital flows transaction status present in the request rather than defaulting to the standard capital flow lifecycle status.
This optional flag is useful for systems that need to create capital flows transactions in an authorized or confirmed status, or update transactions to cancelled status in single step.
By default, this value is "False", which results in creating transactions in an open status.
Setting this value to "True" allows users flexibility to create transactions in either authorized or confirmed status, with authorizerUserId or approverUserId provided respectively; or update transactions to cancelled status in single step, with cancelRequestor and cancelApprover provided.

includePartialErrors.title:
Indicates the response contains partial errors or not
(-- api-linter: core::0144::message-field-plural=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because it better describes the goal of this flag --)
